channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Super Bowl ad spots that cost millions a piece already sold out even though the event is still more than 150 days away
item.description: NBCUniversal, which has the rights to next February’s Super Bowl, has entirely sold out ad inventory during the big game.

item.title: McDonald’s CEO is grappling with a ‘two-tier economy’ as he slashes prices on value meals—and signals backing for a minimum wage increase
item.description: “Particularly with middle- and lower-income consumers, they’re feeling under a lot of pressure right now,” Chris Kempczinski said on CNBC.

item.title: Trump says the video of garbage bags dropped out of a White House window was AI-generated, ironically adding, people ‘blame AI’ to cover up bad things
item.description: Despite the president’s denial, the video remains authentic, according to multiple officials.

item.title: One out of every 4 homes is at ‘severe or extreme’ climate risk, study says
item.description: Some $12.7 trillion of Americans' housing wealth is exposed to the climate change crisis.

item.title: Rural towns are handing out $10,000 relocation bonuses to poach high-earning remote workers
item.description: Forget corporate tax breaks. Cities now pay remote workers to move in.

item.title: Slower hiring, wary consumers: Fed’s beige book points to sluggish U.S. economy
Markets entering a new ‘postmodern’ era, Goldman says. How investors can win.
Nasdaq, S&P 500 end higher on Big Tech rally, while Dow lags and closes lower
Fed officials struggle to explain slowing economy, adding to rate-cut prospects
Salesforce posts earnings beat, but stock's drop shows investors' AI concerns
